course_title: The Secret Life of Language: Words and Sentences

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate a well-founded understanding of linguistics as a discipline and how it relates to and differs from other disciplines.
Recognise elements of words, sentences and meaning which are common to all human languages as well as the ways in which languages may differ.
Understand how people use words and sentences for social purposes, how they change over time, and how children acquire them.
Engage in hypothesis testing, critical assessment of evidence and evaluation of modes of argumentation as applied to the analysis of words and sentences.

assessments.due_date:
19/03/2026 - 20/03/2026

Quiz 1 will become available to students on Thursday 19th March at 2:00pm and must be submitted by Friday 20th March at 5:00pm. Once you have begun the assessment, you will have 20 minutes in total to complete it, so you must begin by at least 4:40pm on 20th March for a timely submission. The Quiz will be available through Inspera.
assessments.task_description:
Quiz 1 will assess course content from Weeks 1-3. It will be available through Inspera. It will consist of multiple choice, multiple answer, drag-and-drop, and other simple format questions.

The Quiz will become available to students on Thursday 19th March at 2:00pm and must be submitted by Friday 20th March at 5:00pm. Once you have begun the assessment, you will have 20 minutes in total to complete it, so you must begin by at least 4:40pm on 20th March for a timely submission. It is expected that Quiz 1 will take 15 minutes to complete, plus an extra 5 minutes leeway for technical difficulties.

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

See the UQ Library Guide to acknowledging and referencing AI.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: This is a timed activity. It is conducted on the Inspera platform, and answers are automatically submitted at the designated end time.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
14/04/2026 - 17/04/2026

The Assessment will become available to students on Tuesday 14th April at 10:00am and must be submitted via TurnItIn by Friday 17th April at 5:00pm.
assessments.task_description:
The Mid-semester Assessment is a problem set to be completed at home. The problem set focuses on content from Weeks 1-6, and will consist of problems related to morphology and syntax. The file will be available to be downloaded from Blackboard. The Assessment will become available to students on Tuesday 14th April at 10:00am and must be submitted by Friday 17th April at 5:00pm. Completed assessments must be submitted via TurnItIn.

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

See the UQ Library Guide to acknowledging and referencing AI.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Download the Mid-semester Assessment from Blackboard. Upload completed assessment as PDF file via TurnItIn. Handwritten answers should be scanned (or photographed) and saved as a PDF for submission.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This is a centrally-administered examination scheduled during the examination period at the end of semester.

The Final Exam will focus on material from Weeks 7-13, and will also cover material from the rest of the course (Weeks 1-6).

All material in lectures, lecture slides, worksheets/activities, and tutorials may potentially be included in this assessment item.

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
